content:
• Thursday, February 28, 2013
  • AT

    Atlantic Power (NYSE:AT): Q4 EPS of -$0.50 misses by $0.47. Project Revenue of $113.9M. Shares...

    Atlantic Power (NYSE:AT): Q4 EPS of -$0.50 misses by $0.47. Project Revenue of $113.9M. Shares -11.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • GPS

    The Gap Inc. (NYSE:GPS) declares $0.15/share quarterly dividend, 20% increase from prior...

    The Gap Inc. (NYSE:GPS) declares $0.15/share quarterly dividend, 20% increase from prior dividend of $0.125. Forward yield 1.82%. For shareholders of record Apr. 10. Payable May 01. Ex-div date Apr. 08. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM
  • ANAC

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ANAC) announces positive preliminary results from the second of...

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ANAC) announces positive preliminary results from the second of two Phase 3 trials of tavaborole, a topical anti-fungal for the treatment of onychomycosis, a fungal infection of the nail and nail bed that affects approximately 35M people in the U.S. Results from the first Phase 3 trial were announced on January 29, and in both studies, achieved statistically significant and clinically meaningful results on all primary and secondary endpoints. Shares +3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM
  • SFLY

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SFLY +8%. DECK +8%. XXIA +8%. CRM +5%. GRPN +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SFLY +8%. DECK +8%. XXIA +8%. CRM +5%. GRPN +4%.
    After-hours top losers: YOKU -17%. OVTI -10%. TRX -8%. IEP -6%. SONS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • RNDY

    Roundy's (NYSE:RNDY): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $981.9M (+1.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Roundy's (NYSE:RNDY): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $981.9M (+1.4% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • MDR

    More on McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q4 comes up shy on a per share basis but beats on revenue as total...

    More on McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q4 comes up shy on a per share basis but beats on revenue as total sales jumped 22% AH. Net profit grew amid strong revenue growth, led by its Asia-Pacific business. Backlog was $5.1B, up sharply from $3.9B a year earlier, but down from $5.3B at the end of Q3. The company lowers sales estimates for FY13, now expecting total revenue of about $3B. Analysts are looking for $ 3.12B. Shares -5.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST) says the FDA has designated the company's late-stage antibiotic...

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST) says the FDA has designated the company's late-stage antibiotic candidate, ceftolozane/tazobactam, as a Qualified Infectious Disease Product for the indications of Hospital-Acquired Bacterial Pneumonia, Ventilator-Associated Bacterial Pneumonia and Complicated Urinary Tract Infections. Additionally, the FDA also granted the drugs Fast Track status for Complicated Intra-Abdominal Infections and Clostridium difficile-Associated Diarrhea. Shares +4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • GTATQ

    While peers Aixtron and Veeco rallied thanks to Aixtron's Q4 report, GT Advanced (GTAT -6.5%)...

    While peers Aixtron and Veeco rallied thanks to Aixtron's Q4 report, GT Advanced (GTAT -6.5%) hit multi-year lows after missing Q4 EPS estimates. 2013 guidance is broad: revenue of $500M-$600M and EPS of $0.25-$0.45 vs. a consensus of $538.1M and $0.30. Backlog fell to $1.25B from Q3's $1.5B, and new orders amounted to just $6.5M vs. $49.2M in Q3. A credit facility has been restructured so as to waive financial obligations through 2H14. In return, GTAT agrees to pay down $40M, decrease its revolver facility by $50M, and agree to minimum liquidity/EBITDA levels. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • OVTI

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) OmniVision (OVTI - earnings) expects FQ4 revenue of $300M-$330M and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) OmniVision (OVTI - earnings) expects FQ4 revenue of $300M-$330M and EPS of $0.14-$0.29, below a consensus of $371.4M and $0.32. 2) Youku (YOKU - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of RMB480M-RMB520M ($77.2M-$83.6M), below a consensus of RMB551.3M ($88.6M). 3) Splunk (SPLK - earnings) expects FQ1 revenue of $52M-$54M, largely above a $52M consensus. FY14 (ends Jan. '14) guidance is for revenue of $260M-$270M vs. a $263.2M consensus. OVTI -9.2% AH. YOKU -16.1%. SPLK +4.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU): Q4 EPS of -$0.07. Revenue of $102.1M. Shares -17% AH. (PR)

    Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU): Q4 EPS of -$0.07. Revenue of $102.1M. Shares -17% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • KOG

    More on Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q4 beats on the bottom line. Oil & gas sales of...

    More on Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q4 beats on the bottom line. Oil & gas sales of $131M, a 138% increase Y/Y and a 17% increase Q/Q. 1.7M MBOE sold or an average of 18,200 BOE per day during the quarter, as compared to 662K BOE, or an average of 7,200 BOE/d in the same period in 2011. Shares -1.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 12 Comments
  • MDR

    McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q4 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $996M (+22% Y/Y) beats by...

    McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q4 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $996M (+22% Y/Y) beats by $14.51M. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ3 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $423.5M beats by $12.15M....

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ3 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $423.5M beats by $12.15M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) CEO Andrew Mason is out, and the board has begun a search for a...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) CEO Andrew Mason is out, and the board has begun a search for a replacement. Executive chairman Eric Lefkofsky and vice chairman Ted Leonsis have been appointed to a newly-created Office of the Chief Executive. Shares +6.4% AH. (PR) (Groupon Q4)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 9 Comments
  • ALSK

    Alaska Communication (NASDAQ:ALSK): Q4 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $95.1M (+8.7%...

    Alaska Communication (NASDAQ:ALSK): Q4 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $95.1M (+8.7% Y/Y) beats by $6.4M. Shares +13.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • ISRG

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -11%) plunge at the close on news that it's being probed by...

    Shares of Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -11%) plunge at the close on news that it's being probed by U.S. regulators over the safety of its robots. The regulators have contacted surgeons at key hospitals, requesting that they list any complications they may have seen with ISRG's surgical robots.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 14 Comments
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) rip 12% higher AH after the company smashes the...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) rip 12% higher AH after the company smashes the earnings estimates of analysts with its Q4 report. Ugg brand sales rose 2.9% Y/Y to $584.8M while Sanuk increased 39.2% to $15.3M. E-commerce sales were a bright spot, rising 30.6% to $87.6M, but gross margin rates were down sharply compared to a year ago. For FY13, the company expects revenue to move 7% higher and EPS to rise by 5% above 2012 levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $65.2M (+51% Y/Y) beats by...

    Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $65.2M (+51% Y/Y) beats by $5.11M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): FQ4 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $834.7M (+32% Y/Y) beats...

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): FQ4 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $834.7M (+32% Y/Y) beats by $3.9M. Expects FQ1 revenue of $882M-$887M and EPS of $0.40-$0.42 vs. a consensus of $886M and $0.42. Expects FY14 (ends Jan. '14) revenue of $3.82B-$3.87B and EPS of $1.93-$1.97 vs. a consensus of $3.85B and $1.95. Shares +5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.06. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)

    SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.06. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 13 Comments
  • GPS

    Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $4.28B misses by $0.37B. Shares +1.1%...

    Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $4.28B misses by $0.37B. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • DS

    The spinoff of New Residential from Newcastle (NCT +1.8%) by quarter's end is on track, says...

    The spinoff of New Residential from Newcastle (NCT +1.8%) by quarter's end is on track, says Chairman Wes Edens on the earnings call (transcript). One "actionable" idea for 2013 from Edens: The non-performing loan market - "This could be the year where a lot of that does break loose .. the (GSEs) own many hundreds of billions." With nearly $300M to invest after the last capital raise, NCT has the funds to be a player.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • DRAD

    Diagnostic imaging system developer Digirad (DRAD +4.7%) gains after reporting earnings and...

    Diagnostic imaging system developer Digirad (DRAD +4.7%) gains after reporting earnings and renewing its commitment to buying back shares, but maybe what's really got investors excited is a plan to reduce costs beginning with moving operations from California to Atlanta. Cost savings might reach 30%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • ORN

    Construction and dredging-services company Orion Marine Group (ORN +4%) moves up today after...

    Construction and dredging-services company Orion Marine Group (ORN +4%) moves up today after reporting a better than expected Q4 on a 78% Y/Y jump in total sales. Despite the better results, D.A. Davidson remains cautious however, noting that ORN's "near-term prospects remain uncertain" as the quarter showed it bid on much less business than prior periods.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • STP

    Fears are growing the Chinese government won't bail out Suntech (STP -14.5%) debtholders ahead...

    Fears are growing the Chinese government won't bail out Suntech (STP -14.5%) debtholders ahead of a $541M March 31 payment, writes Axiom Capital's Gordon Johnson, stoking a selloff in the process. Though Johnson expects a bailout to happen, he notes Suntech shares will likely plummet if it doesn't, given the fraud-wracked solar module has little chance of making the payment through other means. Suntech is currently talking with the Wuxi, China city government about support.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • HLF

    "Ackman has given us the opportunity to buy a company at a discount . and for that, I thank...

    "Ackman has given us the opportunity to buy a company at a discount ... and for that, I thank him," Carl Icahn tells Bloomberg following news of him gaining two board slots at Herbalife (HLF +6.3%). Asked if he would add another 10% of the company to his near 14% stake, he says he's not sure.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 4 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF +6.4%) resumes trading with shares nearly doubling their pre-announcement gains....

    Herbalife (HLF +6.4%) resumes trading with shares nearly doubling their pre-announcement gains. Icahn (and related entities) currently own 13.6% of the company and the board expansion agreement allows Icahn to increase the size of his stake to up to 25%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF +3.7%) is halted on news it's expanded its board with two Icahn reps nominated to...

    Herbalife (HLF +3.7%) is halted on news it's expanded its board with two Icahn reps nominated to fill the slots. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 10 Comments
  • ANIK

    Anika Therapeutics (ANIK +15%) rallies sharply today after easily beating Q4 estimates...

    Anika Therapeutics (ANIK +15%) rallies sharply today after easily beating Q4 estimates yesterday. Total sales grew by 23% Y/Y, driven by strong demand for Orthovisc - revenue in its U.S. market was up nearly 42% for the full year - and bottom line margins benefited from cost savings from its restructuring efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • AIXXF

    Beaten-down Aixtron (AIXG +10.6%) skies higher after reporting Q4 revenue of €77.5M...

    Beaten-down Aixtron (AIXG +10.6%) skies higher after reporting Q4 revenue of €77.5M ($101.4M), soundly above a €66.1M consensus. EPS, hurt by restructuring efforts, came in at -€0.43, well below a -€0.07 consensus. Backlog fell 44% Y/Y to €79.4M and management declined to provide formal guidance, but it also thinks a 2H improvement in LED equipment is possible, and sees "incremental demand" from non-LED semiconductor apps for its MOCVD systems. Rival MOCVD system maker Veeco (VECO +4.1%) is up in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • BABY

    Natus Medical (BABY +8.5%) racks up a healthy gain on an upbeat FY13 forecast, and in spite of...

    Natus Medical (BABY +8.5%) racks up a healthy gain on an upbeat FY13 forecast, and in spite of posting a mixed Q4 that beat on its EPS but missed on revenue. For Q1, the company sees EPS of $0.09 - $0.10 on revenues of $83M - $85M. Analysts are looking for $0.09 EPS on revenues of $83.94M. FY13 EPS is expected to be around $0.81 - $0.84 on revenues of $362M - $367M. The Street view is EPS of $0.82 on revenues of $359.02M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • LB

    Did Limited Brands (LTD +3.9%) say a lot by merely reiterating its prior February guidance for...

    Did Limited Brands (LTD +3.9%) say a lot by merely reiterating its prior February guidance for low single digit comparable-store sales growth? With other retailers staying mute (J.C. Penney) or offering warnings on February sales (Wal-Mart, Target, AutoZone) - just holding serve doesn't look quite as unappetizing. During the LTD earnings call, execs highlighted how they protected the brand instead of moving hyper-promotional over the holiday shopping period (transcript).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • IMH

    Highflier Impac Mortgage Holdings (IMH -20%) plummets after Q4 earnings, with investors spooked...

    Highflier Impac Mortgage Holdings (IMH -20%) plummets after Q4 earnings, with investors spooked by declining mortgage lending earnings thanks to a larger-than-expected fall in the origination pipeline. The company blames seasonality combined with the Fed's QE∞ causing a bump in interest rates. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • CREX

    Midday top 10 gainers: RNIN +65%. IFMI +60%. HGSH +23%. ANIK +18%. FSGI +17%. PANL +16%. LTBR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: RNIN +65%. IFMI +60%. HGSH +23%. ANIK +18%. FSGI +17%. PANL +16%. LTBR +16%. ZGNX +15%. FARO +14%. ATSG +13%.
    Midday top 10 losers: PKT -29%. BSFT -28%. IMH -20%. GRPN -19%. JCP -15%. FREE -12%. AMBO -12%. GVA -11%. TEO -11%. DVR -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • CYTR

    CytRx (CYTR +10.2%) says its completed the enrollment of 140 patients in its Phase 2b clinical...

    CytRx (CYTR +10.2%) says its completed the enrollment of 140 patients in its Phase 2b clinical trial with its oral retinoid compound tamibarotene in combination with chemotherapeutic agents as a first-line treatment for patients with advanced non-small-cell lung cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +5.8%) shrugs off a negative article in The Street Sweeper...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +5.8%) shrugs off a negative article in The Street Sweeper yesterday to trade higher in spite posting a mixed FQ1 earnings report. The company beat on a per share basis but missed on its top line consensus as revenue was impacted from hurrican Sandy. Going forward the company reaffirms its guidance for FY13, still expecting net revenues to increase more than 15% and net income to increase by approximately 20%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • SGMO

    Sangamo Biosciences (SGMO +9.4%) pops again today after being initiated by Lazard with a Buy...

    Sangamo Biosciences (SGMO +9.4%) pops again today after being initiated by Lazard with a Buy rating and a target price of $16 a share. The stock's been on fire the couple sessions on no significant news, having risen 18% since Tuesday. Worth noting: the stock has a short ratio of 9.1 and short interest of 6.1M shares at present, versus an average of around 3.15 for its sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • RVBD

    Sterne Agee cuts Riverbed (RVBD -2.9%) to Neutral from Buy in the wake of its CFO change....

    Sterne Agee cuts Riverbed (RVBD -2.9%) to Neutral from Buy in the wake of its CFO change. Riverbed, which earlier this month disclosed its CTO is leaving, is making fresh 2013 lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • PKT

    A Q4 miss and light guidance lead Procera (PKT -29%) to go into freefall. Rival Allot (ALLT -4%)...

    A Q4 miss and light guidance lead Procera (PKT -29%) to go into freefall. Rival Allot (ALLT -4%) is off more moderately. Procera is forecasting 25%-30% 2013 revenue growth, below a 38% consensus, and sees most of this growth happening in 2H. Operating losses are expected in 1H - the Street has been expecting profits - before a 2H return to profitability. On the earnings call, management blamed "lumpiness" in tier-1 carrier orders, while insisting Procera saw no "material" competitive losses in Q4. The Vineyard acquisition has increased opex.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTG

    MGIC Investment (MTG +4.6%) reverses sharp early losses on heavy volume as management - on the...

    MGIC Investment (MTG +4.6%) reverses sharp early losses on heavy volume as management - on the earnings call - says an external capital raise is available should the company decide to reduce its risk-to-capital ratio.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • PTX

    Pernix Therapeutics (PTX -2.6%) slips this morning, despite its announcement that its Hawthorn...

    Pernix Therapeutics (PTX -2.6%) slips this morning, despite its announcement that its Hawthorn Pharmaceuticals unit has received FDA approval for Vituz, a prescription medication for coughs and colds. The company also said its Cypress Pharmaceuticals unit got final FDA approval for Mefenamic Acid Capsules, a generic version of Ponstel, for relief of mild-to-moderate pain in patients 14 years of age and older and the treatment of primary dysmenorrhea.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • FIO

    Mizuho starts Fusion-io (FIO +4%) at Buy, and joins a long list of firms declaring the...

    Mizuho starts Fusion-io (FIO +4%) at Buy, and joins a long list of firms declaring the server flash memory module maker a possible buyout target for a bigger enterprise IT name (previous). Working in Fusion-io's favor: the company's low-latency technology and a flurry of M&A activity in the enterprise flash hardware space. Working against it: the fact its business model requires it to stay on friendly terms with many server/storage OEMs who compete against each other.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    Even after a 175% rally over the last 3 months, SunPower (SPWR +4.4%) still has room to run,...

    Even after a 175% rally over the last 3 months, SunPower (SPWR +4.4%) still has room to run, asserts Citi's Shahriar Pourreza; his note is helping SunPower rally back above $12. Pourreza is upbeat about the impact of new solar financing options, a robust deal pipeline, and the ability of SunPower's Japanese JV to win Middle Eastern projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • PQ

    Petroquest Energy (PQ -6.3%) takes a hit today after its Q4 missed on both top and bottom line...

    Petroquest Energy (PQ -6.3%) takes a hit today after its Q4 missed on both top and bottom line consensus. The company turned to a net loss for the quarter as its bottom line was hit by lower prices, higher operating expenses and ceiling test writedowns, which largely offset an 11% increase in production. For Q1, the company sees production volumes of 87 MMcfe/d - 92 MMcfe/d, with gas up 80%, oil up 9%, and NGL up 11%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • JCP

    When push comes to shove it looks like it will be cash flow that forces J.C. Penney (JCP -18.8%)...

    When push comes to shove it looks like it will be cash flow that forces J.C. Penney (JCP -18.8%) to make dramatic shifts in strategy. The firm fell below its target of $1B in cash by the end of Q4 and had to stretch out vendor payments just to make $930M. Analysts pushing pencil to paper can't figure out how more investments in the shops strategy won't leave the retailer at or below $300M by the end of Q1. The ideas for a turnaround are varied, but most don't include letting Ron Johnson-palooza continue.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 16 Comments
  • CTRX

    Catamaran (CTRX -5%) beats on it's Q4, but the stock its trading lower after CEO Mark Thierer...

    Catamaran (CTRX -5%) beats on it's Q4, but the stock its trading lower after CEO Mark Thierer failed to quell concerns by investors over the potential loss of its business with Cigna (CI -1.3%) - a key question surrounding the pharmacy-benefits manager- and the earnings impact if CTRX winds up losing them.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • OLED

    A short squeeze and positive sell-side notes help Universal Display (PANL +11.4%) shoot back...

    A short squeeze and positive sell-side notes help Universal Display (PANL +11.4%) shoot back above $30 following its mixed Q4 results. Cowen and Deutsche both think PANL's 2013 guidance is conservative, and the former sees Samsung's Galaxy S IV, OLED TV sales, and new licenses all acting as catalysts. On the earnings call, management noted LG Display (NYSE:LPL) plans to spend 54% of its 2013 capex on OLED production, and that it's discussing "commercialization roadmaps" with partners for its encapsulation tech, which is seen as key to flexible OLEDs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • AGNC

    American Capital Agency (AGNC -3.5%) prices its 50M share secondary at what appears to be...

    American Capital Agency (AGNC -3.5%) prices its 50M share secondary at what appears to be $31.60/share for gross proceeds of $1.5B. Underwriters have the option to purchase another 7.5M shares. The float was 338M shares prior to the offering. Book value as of Dec. 31 was $31.64. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 7 Comments
  • BKS

    Heard during Barnes & Noble's (BKS +3%) earnings call: 1) Further steps to reduce Nook Media...

    Heard during Barnes & Noble's (BKS +3%) earnings call: 1) Further steps to reduce Nook Media costs will be undertaken with underlying profitability an issue. 2) On the hardware business, the company concedes the market has shifted toward a consumer preference for multi-function tablets away from e-readers and that big players are "resonating" in the market more than B&N. The company will "adjust" quickly. 3) Contrary to news reports, the company says it will not accelerate store closings with 95% of its stores still profitable. A new store concept may be tested. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • LFC

    China Life Insurance (LFC -2.3%) said last night 2012 profit likely declined 40% from a year...

    China Life Insurance (LFC -2.3%) said last night 2012 profit likely declined 40% from a year ago. The news was inline with market expectations and shares rose 2.4% in Shanghai. Nevertheless, the ADRs are trading lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupocalypse Now: the daily deals leader is hit with 3 downgrades following an EPS miss and...

    Groupocalypse Now: the daily deals leader is hit with 3 downgrades following an EPS miss and soft guidance. Wells Fargo, cutting Groupon (GRPN -23.3%) to Market Perform, declares "the company is moving away from a technology platform for merchants and into a discount inventory overstock retailer," and sees its margin weakness as proof. Wells adds this shift hurts Groupon's brand and puts it "on a collision course with Amazon." Evercore remains bearish, but is encouraged by Groupon's billings, and thinks new initiatives such as Local Marketplace are helping out. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • IOC

    Shares of InterOil (IOC -6.6%) move lower after the company's Q4 report misses the revenue...

    Shares of InterOil (IOC -6.6%) move lower after the company's Q4 report misses the revenue estimates of analysts. During the quarter, the company says the development segments of upstream and midstream liquefaction shed $59.6M from profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 6 Comments
  • NGN

    NeoGenomics (NGN +8.6% to $3.40) prices an offering of 3.15M shares at $3 each, with the company...

    NeoGenomics (NGN +8.6% to $3.40) prices an offering of 3.15M shares at $3 each, with the company selling 2.85M shares and a stockholder 300K. NeoGenomics expects to receive net proceeds of $7.8M, which it will use to pay debt and for general purposes. There's also a greenshoe option of 472,500 shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 1 Comment

    Sounding like it's going to focus on shareholder value instead of green energy, Rentech (RTK...

    The yen is lower against the dollar following Haruhiko Kuroda's nomination as the BOJ governor, with the greenback +0.2% at ¥92.41. The Nikkei rises 2.1% after falling sharply in the previous two sessions. Kuroda has advocated an inflation target for the BOJ for over a decade and reckons Japan can hit 2% within two years.
